snippet: History shows that candidates have different ways to score in presidential debates and change voters’ minds, but only twice have debates appeared to alter the election’s result.
abstract: Political Memo; historical precedent shows that Mitt Romney is unlikely to significantly improve his standing during upcoming debates against Pres Obama; only two past candidates--John F Kennedy in 1960 and George W Bush in 2000--have won elections seemingly as a result of their strong debate performance.
lead_paragraph: History shows that candidates have different ways to score in presidential debates and change voters’ minds, but only twice have debates appeared to alter the election’s result.

headline.seo: Using Debates to Turn Electoral Tide: Difficult but Not Impossible
headline.main: Debates Can Shift a Race’s Outcome, but It’s Not Easy
headline.print_headline: Using Debates to Turn Electoral Tide Is Difficult But Not Impossible
